results.title: Northern Territory/Indonesia
results.brief_description: Presented by Paul Murphy, this is an excerpt from SBS Television’s “Dateline” program. It presents an examination of the multidimensional nature of the relations between the Northern Territory and Indonesia.

results.title: Northern Territory mining
results.creator_credit: Don Saunders, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Minerals of all kinds have a key role to play in Australian development. Peko Mines at Tennant Creek and ore deposits in the surrounding areas of Juno, Ivanhoe and Orlando; iron ore deposits south of Darwin; bauxite prospecting at Gove; manganese production by Groot Eylandt Mining Company; and potential oil and gas deposits in the Amadeus Basin, are attracting capital investment and resulting in new centres of population being established.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Saunders, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Northern Territory Contact. No. 12
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Solar village. In the little township of Nguiu, on Bathurst Island a solar power plant run by Aborigines, has been built, which supplies electricity to the settlement of 800 people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.title: Northern Territory Contact. No. 08
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Beulah Lowe is a dedicated teacher, helping Aboriginal children at Milingimbi to learn Gupapuyngu, their own language, in the bi-lingual educational program adopted in some Territory schools.

results.title: Northern Territory Contact. No. 07
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Crocodiles have lived in Australia for about 170 million years. Twenty years ago, they were near to extinction but good management and conservation of existing populations has resulted in raising their numbers again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.title: Northern Territory Contact. No. 06
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The new railway line from Alice Springs to Darwin was opened by Princess Alexandra in 1980. It replaces the famous old train known as ‘the Ghan’.
